project.name: booking22
project.shortDescription: Seam 2.2 Booking Example - EAR (including a tutorial)
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam in a Java EE 5 environment. Transaction and persistence context management is handled by the EJB container. This example has been tested on JBoss EAP 5.0. It includes the booking22, booking22-ear,booking22-test and booking22-ejb projects.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EAP 5.0
This project example requires Seam version 2.2.0
The TestNG plugin is required if you want to run Seam tests. You can install it using the following update site: http://beust.com/eclipse

project.name: photoalbum
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of RichFaces components. It includes the photoalbum,photoalbum-ear and photoalbum-ejb projects. The example requires Seam 2.2 and JBoss EAP 4.3/JBoss EAP 5.0/JBoss AS 4.2.x/JBoss AS 5.x.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss EAP 4.3/JBoss EAP 5.0/JBoss AS 4.2.x/JBoss AS 5.x
This project example requires Seam version 2.2.0

project.name: dvdstore22
project.shortDescription: Seam 2.2 DVD Store Example - EAR (including a test project)
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam with jBPM pageflow and business process management. It includes the dvdstore22,dvdstore22-ear,dvdstore22-test and dvdstore22-ejb projects.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EAP 5.0
This project example requires Seam version 2.2.0
The TestNG plugin is required if you want to run Seam tests. You can install it using the following update site: http://beust.com/eclipse

project.name: dvdstoreall
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of Seam with jBPM pageflow and business process management. It includes the dvdstore,dvdstore-ear and dvdstore-ejb projects. It requires JBoss EAP 4.3/JBoss AS 4.2.x and Seam 2.0.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EAP 4.3 or JBoss AS 4.2.x
This project example requires Seam version 2.0

Requires JBoss EAP 4.3/JBoss AS 4.2.x, Seam 2.0 and testng plugins. It includes the jboss-seam-jpa and jboss-seam-jpa-test projects.

project.name: testjavaportlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss Java Portlet. It runs on JBoss EPP 4.3 or JBoss Portal 2.7.x.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 4.3 or JBoss Portal 2.7.x

project.name: testjsfportlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss JSF Portlet. It runs on JBoss EPP 4.3 or JBoss Portal 2.7.x.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 4.3 or JBoss Portal 2.7.x

project.name: testseamportlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss Seam Portlet. It runs on JBoss EPP 4.3/JBoss Portal 2.7.x and Seam 2.0.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 4.3 or JBoss Portal 2.7.x
This project example requires Seam version 2.0

project.name: helloworld
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This example is to prove that the ESB is is properly configured and happy. As well as to demonstrate the needed minimal files to make a basic ESB component execute.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: helloworld_action
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld Action Example - ESB
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This example is to demonstrate the use of multiple action invocations from a single configuration. You can use a single Action class and make multiple method calls or use multiple Action classes.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: helloworld_file_action
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB HelloWorld File Action Example - ESB
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This is a basic example of using the File gateway feature of the JBoss ESB. Files that are found in a particular directory with a particular extension are sent to a JMS queue with actions for processing. Before deploy the project, please change some properties according to the readme.txt file.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: webservice_consumer1
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service consumer1 Example
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This example demonstrates how to consume a 181 Web Service in an ESB action. This ESB will make a webservice request that requires a single "toWhom" string parameter. The webservice will return a greeting response. The ESB simply displays the response on the console.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: webservice_producer
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service producer Example
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This sample demonstrates how to deploy a JSR181 Webservice endpoint on JBossESB using the SOAPProcessor action.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: transform_CSV2XML
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This sample demonstrates how to transform a comma separated value (CSV) file to an xml. The tranformation is done by configuring Smooks and performing two transformation, one transformation from CSV to an intermediate xml format, and a second transformation from the intermediate xml format to the target xml.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: transform_XML2POJO
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. The purpose of the simple_transformation sample is to illustrate the use of Smooks performing a simple transformation by converting a XML file into Java POJOs.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: transform_XML2XML_date_manipulation
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML date-manipulation Example
project.description:
NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This is another simple sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB.
This sample is an extension of the "transformation_XML2XML_simple" Quickstart, demonstrating how JBoss ESB Transformations can simplify your XSLT transformations by combining the power of XSLT with Java. In this Quickstart, we use Java to perform the ugly string manipulation on the SampleOrder date field (see OrderDate.java) and use XSLT for what it's good at i.e. Templating. Again, the transformed SampleOrder.xml message is just printed to the Java console (message before and after).

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: transform_XML2XML_simple
project.description: NOTE: Before import this example, please make sure that there is a runtime named "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime" in the workspace. This is a very basic sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB. It applies a very simple XSLT to a SampleOrder.xml message and prints the before and after XML to the console.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss SOA-P 4.3.0 and the runtime name should be "jboss-soa-p.4.3.0 Runtime"

project.name: helloworld
project.description: This example is to prove that the ESB is is properly configured and happy. As well as to demonstrate the needed minimal files to make a basic ESB component execute. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

Files that are found in a particular directory with a particular extension are sent to a JMS queue with actions for processing. Before deploy the project, please change some properties according to the readme.txt file. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: webservice_consumer1
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service consumer1 Example
project.description: This example demonstrates how to consume a 181 Web Service in an ESB action. This ESB will make a webservice request that requires a single "toWhom" string parameter. The webservice will return a greeting response. The ESB simply displays the response on the console. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: webservice_producer
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Web Service producer Example
project.description: This sample demonstrates how to deploy a JSR181 Webservice endpoint on JBossESB using the SOAPProcessor action. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: transform_CSV2XML
project.description: This sample demonstrates how to transform a comma separated value (CSV) file to an xml. The tranformation is done by configuring Smooks and performing two transformation, one transformation from CSV to an intermediate xml format, and a second transformation from the intermediate xml format to the target xml. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: transform_XML2POJO
project.description: The purpose of the simple_transformation sample is to illustrate the use of Smooks performing a simple transformation by converting a XML file into Java POJOs. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: transform_XML2XML_date_manipulation
project.shortDescription: JBoss ESB Smooks XML->XML date-manipulation Example
project.description:
This is another simple sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.
This sample is an extension of the "transformation_XML2XML_simple" Quickstart, demonstrating how JBoss ESB Transformations can simplify your XSLT transformations by combining the power of XSLT with Java. In this Quickstart, we use Java to perform the ugly string manipulation on the SampleOrder date field (see OrderDate.java) and use XSLT for what it's good at i.e. Templating. Again, the transformed SampleOrder.xml message is just printed to the Java console (message before and after).

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: transform_XML2XML_simple
project.description: This is a very basic sample of how to manually define and apply a Message Transformation within JBoss ESB. It applies a very simple XSLT to a SampleOrder.xml message and prints the before and after XML to the console. Example requires a SOA-P 5.x runtime.

fix.property: This project example requires JBoss SOA-P 5.x

project.name: Parts
project.description: This is a simple Teiid Designer model project that demonstrates how a view model can be used to create a virtual relational table that joins multiple physical relational tables. The project also contains a Virtual Database (VDB) which contains the project's models, and in a runtime environment, would also contain the needed connection information for the physical sources. VDBs are used by Teiid to access federated data.

fix.property: This project example requires a Teiid instance running within the JBoss EAP 5.0 or JBoss AS >= 5.1.0

project.name: Portfolio
project.shortDescription: Portfolio Web Service Project Set Example
project.description: This is a Teiid Designer model project that demonstrates how to expose any Teiid data source as a web service. The example will walk through the steps of creating the data sources, creating the VDB and generating/deploying the JbossWS-CXF web service war.

project.name: US States
project.shortDescription: US States SOAP Service Project Set Example
project.description: This is a Teiid Designer model project that demonstrates how to consume a sample SOAP service as a source of data. The example provides the sample SOAP Service and a Teiid Designer project set that executes the service and transforms the responses to relational results.

fix.property: This project example requires a Teiid instance running within the JBoss EAP 5.0

project.name: JSFPortlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss JSF Portlet. It runs on JBoss EPP 5.x or on GateIn 3.1.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 5.x or GateIn 3.1

project.name: RichFacesPortlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss JSF Portlet with RichFaces. It runs on JBoss EPP 5.x or on GateIn 3.1.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 5.x or GateIn 3.1

project.name: SeamPortlet
project.description: This example demonstrates the use of JBoss JSF Portlet with Seam. It runs on JBoss EPP 5.x or on GateIn 3.1.

fix.property: This project example requires the JBoss EPP 5.x or GateIn 3.1
This project example requires Seam version 2.2.0
